job.title: Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer
job.description:
COMPANY: (Can not disclose at this time) TITLE: Data Scientist/Machine Learning EngineerLOCATION: RemoteDuration: 6-12 month to perm   &nbsp;MUST HAVES:  - 5+ Python software development for composition and modularity, debugging and following tracebacks   
  - Strong stats background and concepts including hypothesis testing, correlation, R squared, P-value   
  - Experience with Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Pytorch   
  - Tensorflow functional API, deep learning   
  - Mathematics of machine learning- linear algebra, multivariable calculus   
  - SQL querying   
  - Hyperparameter optimization, regularizing regression models   
&nbsp;PLUSSES:  - Masters or PhD- HIGHLY preferred!!   
  - Ecommerce experience   
&nbsp;DAY TO DAY:&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A company is looking for a Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer to sit remotely within the US.&nbsp;We follow industry standard practices for managing, collaboration, deployment and testing.&nbsp;We deploy and interact with resources on AWS.&nbsp;Responsibilities include:• Analyze large data sets by quantifying the data quality, identifying particular patterns, and visualizing results• Understand business problems and identify the right data sets and ML/Statistical approach to produce the desired outcomes• Adapt to account for changes and be able to propose alternative approaches• Ideate and develop analytics and modeling solutions cross-functionally to build customized, long-term, and sustainable solutions• Provide critical thought leadership and enhance organizational capabilities• Own machine learning pipelines end-to-end• Write production-grade machine learning code using standard engineering practices and deploy models to production• Improve codebase and lead/participate in code reviews with Research Scientists and Data Scientists• Help non-engineers develop their engineering skills• Mentor junior team members and contribute to a culture where everyone is valued&nbsp;
